intro: Arabis lyallii var. nubigena, commonly known as the alpine rock白菜, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. This variety is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs, providing protection against harsh weather conditions.
